text: Boil the water. Pour 1 tablespoon of water into a small bowl and once it is boiled add the saffron. Leave until dissolved. Mix the flour, sugar, 1 tablespoon of oil, and saffron water in the bowl.  Dig a well in the centre of the mixture and pour in the coconut milk, beaten egg and coconut cream. Beat to combine well. Heat the oil. Pour one litre of oil into the wok and heat it up. Add 1 tablespoon of saffron batter at a time and deep fry. Don't overload the pan- 3 to 4 saffron cakes are probably enough at one time. Lift out the golden brown saffron cakes with a spatula. Place them on a paper towel laid on a plate to drain the oil. Sprinkle with icing sugar and desiccated coconut. Serve. A scoop of ice cream goes well with the saffron cakes too.
